title: Intent-driven scheduling of backup jobs
abstract_summary: Framework for scheduling new backup jobs with intent-based constraints. Uses small LLM to extract parameters and schedule iteratively. Validated on thousands of Veritas Netbackup customer policies. Direct backup scheduling application.

title: Resilience-based post disaster recovery optimization for infrastructure system via Deep Reinforcement Learning
authors: Huangbin Liang, Beatriz Moya, Francisco Chinesta, Eleni Chatzi
abstract_summary: Deep Q-learning algorithms for optimal recovery strategies. Maps system states to repair actions under constrained resources. Tests on earthquake recovery for electrical substations. Double DQN superior performance. Demonstrates 89% efficiency gains vs evolutionary algorithms.

title: How Machine Learning-Data Driven Replication Strategies Enhance Fault Tolerance in Large-Scale Distributed Systems
abstract_summary: ML-driven data replication with predictive analytics and reinforcement learning. Forecasts failures and optimizes data placement dynamically. Real-time response to changing workloads. Addresses limitations of static replication approaches.

title: Data Backup System with No Impact on Business Processing Utilizing Storage and Container Technologies
abstract_summary: Eliminates system slowdown and service interruptions during backup via consistency group technology and container platform operator. Ensures backup-original data update order consistency. Enterprise system resilience focus.

title: Dynamic Optimization of Storage Systems Using Reinforcement Learning Techniques
authors: Chiyu Cheng, Chang Zhou, Yang Zhao
abstract_summary: RL-Storage framework using deep Q-learning for storage optimization. Dynamically adjusts cache size, queue depths, readahead settings. Learns from real-time I/O patterns. 40% performance improvement reported.

title: Towards Designing an Energy Aware Data Replication Strategy for Cloud Systems Using Reinforcement Learning
authors: Amir Najjar, Riad Mokadem, Jean-Marc Pierson
abstract_summary: RL-based data replication for cloud systems. Automatically learns system characteristics and adapts to workload changes. Balances availability, fault tolerance, response time, energy consumption, and provider profit.

title: FlashRecovery: Fast and Low-Cost Recovery from Failures for Large-Scale Training of LLMs
abstract_summary: Checkpoint-free recovery framework with real-time failure detection within seconds. Scale-independent task restart on 4800-device cluster in 150 seconds. Optimal RTO/RPO metrics. Nearly constant recovery time regardless of cluster size.

title: Optimizing Frequent Checkpointing via Low-Cost Differential for Distributed Training Systems
abstract_summary: LowDiff framework reuses compressed gradients as differential checkpoints. Batched gradient write optimization. Per-iteration checkpointing feasible. 89.2% training time reduction reported. Enhanced layer-wise variants available.

title: Adaptive Cache Management for Complex Storage Systems Using CNN-LSTM-Based Spatiotemporal Prediction
abstract_summary: CNN-LSTM hybrid model for cache demand prediction. Combines spatial and temporal feature extraction. Significantly outperforms LRU, LFU, RNN, GRU-RNN benchmarks. Reduced MSE/MAE vs traditional methods.

title: A Reinforcement Learning-Driven Task Scheduling Algorithm for Multi-Tenant Distributed Systems
authors: Xiaopei Zhang, Xingang Wang, Xin Wang
abstract_summary: RL-based scheduler using Proximal Policy Optimization. Frames scheduling as Markov decision problem. Handles dynamic resource variation, heterogeneous tenant demands, fairness. Multi-objective optimization for latency, utilization, fairness. Real-world dataset validation.

title: Learning to Schedule: A Supervised Learning Framework for Network-Aware Scheduling of Data-Intensive Workloads
abstract_summary: Supervised learning for network-aware job placement. Forecasts job completion across candidate nodes. Geo-distributed Kubernetes testing. 34-54% higher accuracy vs default scheduler. Incorporates network congestion beyond CPU/memory metrics.

title: A Bring-Your-Own-Model Approach for ML-Driven Storage Placement in Warehouse-Scale Computers
abstract_summary: Lightweight ML models trained at application layer for storage placement. Production deployment at Google scale. 3.47x TCO savings potential vs existing methods. MLSys 2025 venue. Workload-specific model optimization.

title: Recent Advances in Disaster Emergency Response Planning: Integrating Optimization, Machine Learning, and Simulation
abstract_summary: Comprehensive survey of 2019-2024 disaster recovery research. Covers evacuation, facility location, casualty transport, search & rescue, relief distribution. Integrates optimization, ML, and simulation methodologies. Addresses dynamic uncertain complex scenarios.

title: FastPersist: Accelerating Model Checkpointing in Deep Learning
abstract_summary: NVMe optimizations plus write parallelism plus computation overlapping. 116x faster checkpointing than baseline. Per-iteration checkpointing with negligible overhead. Three-pronged optimization approach effective.

title: DataStates-LLM: Lazy Asynchronous Checkpointing for Large Language Models
abstract_summary: Lazy asynchronous multi-level checkpointing approach. Exploits tensor immutability for background copying. 48x faster checkpointing, 2.2x faster end-to-end training. Tested on 180 GPUs. HPDC '24 published.

title: Universal Checkpointing: A Flexible and Efficient Distributed Checkpointing System for Large-Scale DNN Training with Reconfigurable Parallelism
abstract_summary: Decouples checkpoint structure from parallelism strategies. Pattern-based reconfiguration pipeline. Supports broader parallelism options than competitors. Production LLM training deployment. Flexible and efficient framework.
